result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Tiara M. RHODES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Negligent handling of dangerous weapon [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order to Dismsis.
Count 2 of the case is hereby ordered dismissed without prejudice upon the motion of the State.
Motion to dismiss count 2 of the action dismissed without prejudice because the defendant successfully completed the Deferred Judgment Agreement.

records.addlTxt: assigning Judge Robert Dewane to case

Amended Information filed charging four counts:
1) Substantial battery-dvo, 940.19(2)
2) 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety-dvo, 941.30(2)
3) Disorderly conduct/use of dangerous weapon-dvo, 947.01(1)
4) Negligent handling of weapon-dvo, 941.20(1)(a).
NO CONTEST pleas entered to counts 2, 3 and 4.
The Court accepts the plea, finds the defendant guilty and convicts her of counts 3 and 4, disorderly conduct/use of dangerous weapon-dvo and negligent handling of weapon-dvo.  On count 2, the Court withholds entry of judgment of conviction pursuant to a Deferred Judgment Agreement.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted.
On count 2, 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety-dvo, the Court approves the Deferred Judgment Agreement for a period of three (3) years.
Review date:  12-17-2017
On counts 3 and 4, sentence is withheld and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC for three (3) years.
Conditions of probation:
1) Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;
2) Spend sixty (60) days in the county jail, under the Huber Law, on count 3 only, commencing on 01-06-15 at 8:00 a.m.;
3) Pay court costs;
4) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
5) maintain absolute sobriety;
6) take all medications as prescribed and in prescribed doses;
7) Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-25-14 at 10:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 05-22-14 at 1:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-26-14 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree reckless endangerment and substantial battery.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he have no assaultive contact with Palmer J. Allain orhis residence at 1402 New York Avenue, Manitowoc, WI and that she maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
